page.title: 07THE TOLLESBURY RAILWAY
page.content: The railway from{Kelvedon}to {Tollesbury}used to branch off the main line just north east of Kelvedon Station.It followed the route of the present Marshall Close,and crossed Driffield Close.Big jams built up where it crossed Feering Hill,because the guard had to open the gates himself.Then was a small station called{Feering Halt.}A branch went into the Threshleford's Fruit Farm to collect fruit and seeds.There was also a branch,in{Tiptree,}into the Wilkin's Jam Factory.The railway is now closed, but the old platform is still just visible,and houses mark the route. A bit of the old rail is now a kerb up to the station.The railway used to be called the{'Crab and Winkle Line.'
